The presence of a large, slow-moving vehicle ahead can affect the ego vehicle's speed and may require the ego vehicle to maintain a safe following distance or consider overtaking when safe.

1.description and explanation: This object is a large, specialized vehicle typically used for construction purposes. It is characterized by its heavy-duty structure and may be carrying construction materials or equipment. The vehicle appears to be stationary or moving very slowly, possibly due to ongoing work in the area or preparing to turn. The presence of this construction vehicle influences the driving behavior of the ego car by necessitating increased caution, a potential reduction in speed, and preparedness for unexpected stops or detours. driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance behind the construction truck to allow for adequate reaction time in case of sudden stops. Be alert for any potential roadwork ahead that the construction vehicle may be indicating. Overtaking the truck is not currently advisable due to the curve of the road and limited visibility ahead. Continuous monitoring of the truck's signals and brake lights is also recommended to anticipate its movements. Be prepared to adjust speed or change lanes if necessary while ensuring the opposite lane is clear. Monitor the truck's movements for any sudden changes in speed or direction that may indicate potential obstacles in the road ahead. Prepare to overtake if the truck slows down and it is safe and legal to do so on the left side, considering the clear road conditions. Regularly check rear-view and side mirrors for other vehicles that may be approaching to overtake.
